topic.title: Authenticating with Legacy SDK Versions
topic.shortdesc: Pre-RBAC versions of the SDK — those released prior to Couchbase Server 5.0 — can perform authentication against Couchbase Server 5.0 and beyond.

section.title: Upgrading to RBAC-Enabled SDK Versions
section.p: For access to Couchbase Server 5.0 and beyond, developers are recommended to upgrade their SDK to an RBAC-enabled version: this provides a new, optimized authentication interface. Note, however, that following such an SDK-upgrade, the new authentication interface must be used: the old will fail.
The last pre-RBAC version of the Java SDK was 2.4.3. The first RBAC-enabled was 2.4.4. See the SDK Release Notes for more information.
See Start Using the SDK for an example of the new authentication interface.
